intro: Seseli nodiflorum, commonly known as the nodiflorous seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Seseli nodiflorum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
